page.title: 03PARKHURST FOREST.
page.content: In Parkhurst Forest there are mostly oak trees.We saw a plantation of young oaks they were about 1 metre high and they were growing inside plastic tubes to protect the trunks from rabbits and squirrels. There was another plantation of Norway spruce (Christmas trees).There is a wide track leading from Hillis Gate.People go horse riding along there.You must have a 'pass' if you want to ride on the forest tracks.There are always some trees being cut down_mostly tall pine trees about 50 years old.They are used for fence posts.
